\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1} \\
\indent \textbf {} #2 \textbf {} #3
\end{minipage}
}

\newcommand\SpecifyBlock[1][]{%
	\parbox[t][12.4cm][c]{7.8cm}{%
	\begin{description}
  \setkeys{TFQuestions}{#1}%
	\end{description}
	}
	\vspace{-0.2cm}
}

\newcommand{\myshortquestion}[5]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1} \\
\indent \textbf {} #2 \textbf {} #3 \textbf {} #4 \textbf {} #5
\end{minipage}
}

\newcommand{\myquestion}[4]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\begin{description}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\item [a] #2
\vspace{-0.2cm}
\item [b] #3
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\item [c] #4
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\end{description}
\end{minipage}
}

\begin{textblock}{8}(8,0)
\textblocklabel{picture8,0}
\begin{tiny}mpm 2\end{tiny}\\\SpecifyBlock[
Question1 = {1. The manager likes the Muller team. It is competitive.},
Question2 = {2. The Muller team doesn't think maximum profit is the main aim.},
Question3 = {3. The Peterson team puts pressure on customers to buy.},
Question4 = {4. It thinks customer relationships are most important.},
Question5 = {5. The Muller team lies to customers about early delivery.},
Question6 = {6. Its reports are useless. It doesn't want to share information.},
Question7 = {7. The other team is less competitive, and not enthusiastic.},
Question8 = {8. It makes more money than the Muller team.},
Question9 = {9. Both teams have similar ideas about selling.},
]\par
\vspace{-0.2cm}
\end{textblock}
